questions.answer_description:
You need to configure the OneDrive retention period for deleted users.
1. Go to the OneDrive admin center.
2. Select Storage.
3. Set the ג€Days to retain files in OneDrive after a user account is marked for deletionג€ option to 60.
4. Click Save to save the changes.
References:
https://docs.microsoft.com/bs-latn-ba/onedrive/set-retention

comments.content: Correct. SharePoint Admin Center > Settings > OneDrive Retention then modify to 60 days.

discussion.content: Onedirve settings were moved to Sharepoint

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION -
Please wait while the virtual machine loads. Once loaded, you may proceed to the lab section. This may take a few minutes, and the wait time will not be deducted from your overall test time.
When the Next button is available, click it to access the lab section. In this section, you will perform a set of tasks in a live environment. While most functionality will be available to you as it would be in a live environment, some functionality (e.g., copy and paste, ability to navigate to external websites) will not be possible by design.
Scoring is based on the outcome of performing the tasks stated in the lab. In other words, it doesn't matter how you accomplish the task, if you successfully perform it, you will earn credit for that task.
Labs are not timed separately, and this exam may have more than one lab that you must complete. You can use as much time as you would like to complete each lab. But, you should manage your time appropriately to ensure that you are able to complete the lab(s) and all other sections of the exam in the time provided.
Please note that once you submit your work by clicking the Next button within a lab, you will NOT be able to return to the lab.
You may now click next to proceed to the lab.

Lab information -
Use the following login credentials as needed:
To enter your username, place your cursor in the Sign in box and click on the username below.
To enter your password, place your cursor in the Enter password box and click on the password below.
Microsoft 365 Username:
admin@admin.onmicrosoft.com
Microsoft 365 Password: xxxxxxxxxx
If the Microsoft 365 portal does not load successfully in the browser, press CTRL-K to reload the portal in a new browser tab.
The following information is for technical support purposes only:

Lab Instance: 111111111 -
Your organization recently implemented a new data retention policy. The policy requires that all files stored in an employee's Microsoft OneDrive folders be retained for 60 days after the employee is terminated from the organization.
The human resources (HR) department of the organization deletes the user accounts of all terminated employees.
You need to ensure that the organization meets the requirements of the data retention policy.

questions.answer_description:
An app's score in Cloud Discovery is based on categories such as General, Security, Compliance and Legal. Each category has several parameters. For example, the domain registration and consumer popularity parameters are part of the General category. These parameters are known as Score Metrics.
You can modify the default weights given to the Cloud Discovery score configuration. By default, all the various parameters evaluated are given an equal weight. If there are certain parameters that are more or less important to your organization, you can adjust the weight of each score metric.
In this case, we need to lower the weight of the domain registration and consumer popularity score metrics.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cloud-app-security/risk-score

comments.content: Correct and even a more specific link is: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cloud-app-security/risk-score#customizing-the-risk-score

portal.cloudappsecurity.com 
but I assume that you have found it already

discussion.content: Anyone know where to find Cloud App Security? Supposedly you go to the Microsoft 365 admin center | Security | More Resources | Cloud App Security. I don't see More Resources anywhere in the Security & Compliance center. I assume Cloud App Security has a new name.

if you don't want to read it Matt Soseman on Youtube "App Risk scoring in Microsoft Cloud App Security" explains why its score metric that allows you to dive in and change the rating on each category of interest of the item selected.

correct B or A?
What's correct answer?

comments.content: If you look at the screenshot in the specific link posted by Jokke71, it's obviously Score Metrics, answer B.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.
Your company purchases a new financial application named App1.
From Cloud Discovery in Microsoft Cloud App Security, you view the Discovered apps page and discover that many applications have a low score because they are missing information about domain registration and consumer popularity.
You need to prevent the missing information from affecting the score.
What should you configure from the Cloud Discover settings?

HOTSPOT -
You plan to deploy two Microsoft Power Platform environments as shown in the following table.
//IMG//

Which environment type should you use for each environment? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: The provided answers are correct. You can only reset sandbox environment. Just to add this link that shows that the developer environment does not count against storage capacity. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/capacity-storage

Answer1: "You can only copy an environment to a sandbox environment."

Answer2: With the developer environment, you can create unlimited apps for development and test purposes."

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/environments-overview#types-of-environments

You can only reset sandbox environments. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/sandbox-environments#reset-a-sandbox-environment, https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/reset-environment
"Sandbox These are non-production environments, which offer features like copy and reset"
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/environments-overview#types-of-environments

"Create and test apps Yes. You can create unlimited apps for development and test purposes"
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/maker/developer-plan#which-features-are-included-in-the-power-apps-developer-plan
Sandbox environments still count towards the database storage quota on your tenant so option 2 is developer

comments.content: Looks like the provided answers are correct. You can only reset sandbox environments. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/sandbox-environments

discussion.content: Shouldn't it be vice versa - Developer and Sandbox?

comments.content: i feel it should be aswell , have you got any article proving it should be developer and Sandbox ???

discussion.content:
You can only reset sandbox environments.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/reset-environment
https://www.azamba.com/2018/01/18/how-to-reset-a-production-instance-in-microsoft-dynamics-365-crm/
Makes sense

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You have a pilot app named App1 deployed to a Microsoft Power Platform production environment named Prod1.
You need to reset the Prod1 environment in preparation for the production deployment of App1.
Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

You have a Microsoft 365 tenant that contains a Microsoft Power Platform environment.
You need to ensure that only specific users can create new environments.
What should you do in the Power Platform admin center?

discussion.content: in Admin, cog top right, power platform settings

choices.C: From Power Platform settings, modify the Governance settings for the environment.
choices.A: From Data policies, create a new data policy.
choices.D: From Environments, modify the behaviour settings for the default environment.
choices.B: From Data integration, create a new connection set.
